question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_override_oracle_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Event Indexing] Do off-chain systems rely on QueueOracleOverride events at lines 63-69 to track oracle security parameters, and if event is missed or corrupted, could monitoring systems fail to detect malicious overrides? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_override_oracle_action.move] [Function: run()] [Parameter Modification] Can the secp256k1_key, mr_enclave, or expiration_time_ms parameters at lines 77-79 be modified between validate() and actuate() calls if they're passed by reference in Move (though they're passed by value here)? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_override_oracle_action.move] [Function: run()] [Clock Object Swap] Can an attacker provide different Clock objects to validate() (through ctx timing) versus actuate() at line 89-96, causing timestamp inconsistencies in validation versus execution? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_override_oracle_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Concurrent Override] Can multiple transactions call run() concurrently on the same oracle and queue, and without proper locking at lines 54-60, could final state be a mix of both transactions' parameters? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_override_oracle_action.move] [Function: run()] [Gas Exhaustion] Can an attacker pass extremely large secp256k1_key or mr_enclave vectors at lines 77-78, causing run() to consume excessive gas during vector copying at lines 66-67 in event emission? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/queue/queue_override_oracle_action.move] [Function: validate()] [Validation DoS] Can an attacker create many invalid queue/oracle pairs that fail validate() checks at lines 38-43, wasting computational resources and network bandwidth for failed transactions?
